Lecture 1.title: The Basics
Lecture 1.description: Server Information and Setting up the AMP stacks.

Lecture 2.title: Git Learn Lecture and Apache
Lecture 2.description: History of Git and using good Github practices, and learning about the Apache Server.

Lecture 3.title: HTML5 and Markup Languages
Lecture 3.description: The history of Markup Languages and basic introductions on how to use SGML, XML, HTML & XHTML while coding.

Lecture 4.title: Cascading Style Sheet (CSS)
Lecture 4.description: An overview on what CSS is and the basics about how CSS works.

Lecture 5.title: Advanced CSS
Lecture 5.description: A more advanced look into CSS and how to best utilize it with HTML.

Lecture 6.title: JavaScript (JS)
Lecture 6.description: A introduction to JavaScript and the best practices for utilizing it.

Lecture 7.title: AJAX and JSON
Lecture 7.description: A introduction to both AJAX and JSON, the similartites and differences between them, and the best practices for utilizing them.

Lecture 8.title: jQuery
Lecture 8.description: A introduction what is jQuery, and how to add it into existing (or new) code.

Lecture 9.title: Front End Optimization/UX
Lecture 9.description: The best Front End Optimizations to include, and how to check the efficiency of an application.

Lecture 10.title: PHP
Lecture 10.description: Introduction to PHP and how to use classes and functions in PHP.

Lecture 11.title: MySQL
Lecture 11.description: Introduction to MySQL and how to create / edit databases in phpmyadmin.

Lecture 12.title: PHP and MySQL
Lecture 12.description: Introduction to combining PHP and MySQL in order to edit and call information from databases.

Lecture 13.title: PHP and MySQL Part 2
Lecture 13.description: More advanced look into combining PHP and MySQL in order to edit and call information from databases, and how to incorporate effective authentication and authorization practices.

Lab 1.title: Portfolio Wesbite
Lab 1.description: A group lab in which an application was created to showcase a portfolio for each group member.

Lab 2.title: Constitution Day
Lab 2.description: A group lab in which an application was created to showcase annotations of the US Constitution.

Lab 3.title: ITWS Website
Lab 3.description: An individual lab in which a new website is created for the ITWS program here at RPI.

Lab 4.title: GNH Website
Lab 4.description: A group lab in which a new site is built for Gamma Nu Eta, the ITWS Honor Society.

Lab 5.title: Frontend Optimization
Lab 5.description: An individual lab in which the game 'Free Bee' is edited to make a faster and much more efficent site.

Lab 6.title: A Better Calculator
Lab 6.description: An individual lab in which the PHP code provided is improved and added onto to make a imporved version of the calculator.

Lab 7.title: MySQL
Lab 7.description: An  individual lab in which multiple tables are created and synamically edited within phpmyadmin.

Lab 8.title: Course Information
Lab 8.description: An individual lab in which all of the concepts of this course is combined into one assigment.
